com.kiwiwearables.kiwilib

Class Kiwi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kiwiwearables.kiwilib.Kiwi

  • public class Kiwi
extends Object
    Main entry point for motion recognition

    Use with(android.content.Context) for the global singleton instance.
    Call stop() when cleaning up resources for the application or when motion recognition is not required anymore

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static Kiwi with(Context context)
        The global default Kiwi instance.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        Returns:
        The Kiwi instance

      • initUser

        public void initUser(String username,
                     String password,
                     KiwiCallback initCallback)
        Fetches user info and motions related to that user.
        Parameters:
        username - Kiwi developer username
        password - Kiwi developer password
        initCallback - The KiwiCallback to handle what happens after successful login. This runs in the main thread.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(float[] points)
              throws NullPointerException
        You must call this method in order to send a float array of points.
        Parameters:
        points - The float array containing sensor values must have at least 6 values with the first 6 in the following order: { ax, ay, az, gx, gy, gz }
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Thrown if detected engine is not available for some reason. One way to resolve it would be to call with(android.content.Context) and try again. Usually, this state should not occur.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the length of the points array is shorter than expected (6) as mentioned above.

      • setSensorUnits

        public void setSensorUnits(SensorUnits sensorUnits)
        Sets sensor units.
        Parameters:
        sensorUnits - Units of the sensor data (accelerometer and gyroscope)

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(DetectionCallback callback)
        This is the callback instance which will be notified on detection events.
        Parameters:
        callback - The DetectionCallback to call

      • setWebSocketOption

        public void setWebSocketOption(LoggingOptions webSocketEnabled)
                        throws IllegalStateException
        Sets web socket option. This enables data streaming to the Developer panel.
        Parameters:
        webSocketEnabled - Setting this to true enables the web socket setting
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when user has not been initialized with initUser(String, String, KiwiCallback). Needed to identify which user is registering the device.

      • setDebugging

        public void setDebugging(boolean debugging)
        Sets debugging option for debug log messages from the library.
        Parameters:
        debugging - Setting this to true enables the debugging option

      • setCalibrationEnabled

        public void setCalibrationEnabled(boolean calibration)
        Sets calibration option.

        Enabling this will trigger a calibration event the next time motion is detected

        Parameters:
        calibration - Setting this to true enables the calibration option

      • isCalibrationEnabled

        public boolean isCalibrationEnabled()
        Get calibration option state.
        Returns:
        True if calibration is enabled

      • getMotions

        public List<Motion> getMotions()
                        throws IllegalStateException
        Fetch list of available motions.
        Returns:
        The list of motions
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when user has not been initialized with initUser(String, String, KiwiCallback). Needed to identify which motions to fetch depending on the user.

      • setEnabledMotions

        public void setEnabledMotions(List<String> motionIds)
                       throws IllegalStateException
        Sets enabled motions.
        Parameters:
        motionIds - The IDs of the motions to enable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown when user has not been initialized with initUser(String, String, KiwiCallback). If user wasn't initialized, there weren't any motions fetched so this call becomes pretty useless.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop Kiwi and clean all resources. Calling this stops the detection engine. You will have to call with(android.content.Context) again to start it.
